docs.snippet: A deal negotiated with the N.B.A. and four former American Basketball Association teams would end television revenue payments to Ozzie and Daniel Silna, brothers who owned a now-defunct A.B.A. team....
docs.lead_paragraph: A deal negotiated with the N.B.A. and four former American Basketball Association teams would end television revenue payments to Ozzie and Daniel Silna, brothers who owned a now-defunct A.B.A. team.
docs.abstract: Deal negotiated with the NBA and four former American Basketball Association teams would end television revenue payments to Ozzie and Daniel Silna, brothers who owned a now-defunct ABA team; Silnas are to receive a $500 million upfront payment which would end perpetual payments and settle lawsuit filed by brothers.

headline.main: Payout May Come for an A.B.A. Team That Is Long Gone
headline.print_headline: Payout May Come for an A.B.A. Team That Is Long Gone

docs.snippet: Dennis Rodman is the ringleader of an unlikely group headed to North Korea that has left the diplomatic corps puzzled and perhaps a little jealous over the access to Kim Jong-un....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dennis Rodman is the ringleader of an unlikely group headed to North Korea that has left the diplomatic corps puzzled and perhaps a little jealous over the access to Kim Jong-un.
docs.abstract: Dennis Rodman is the ringleader of an unlikely group of basketball players arriving in North Korea that has left the diplomatic corps puzzled and perhaps a little jealous over the access to Kim Jong-un; 12-member team, which includes former NBA players, was hastily assembled by Rodman despite the misgivings of human rights activists, American officials and the league itself.

headline.main: Rodman Leading Team of Improbable Emissaries
headline.print_headline: Unlikely Emissaries Play Odd Diplomatic Game

docs.abstract: Southern Illinois’s men’s basketball team made it back home after an unexpected overnight stay on the floor of a church when team bus became stuck in snowdrift.

docs.snippet: A fired strip club employee masterminded a plot to rob his former employer of up to $500,000 he believed was stored in the business' safe, a plan that unraveled on New Year's Eve and led to the shooting of a Phoenix police officer and a volunteer ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A fired strip club employee masterminded a plot to rob his former employer of up to $500,000 he believed was stored in the business' safe, a plan that unraveled on New Year's Eve and led to the shooting of a Phoenix police officer and a volunteer sheriff's posse member, according to court documents.

headline.main: Police: Phoenix Robbery Inside Job by Fired Worker
headline.print_headline: Police: Phoenix Robbery Inside Job by Fired Worker
